author: agemanning
content:
How do we all feel about starting a testnet next week with latest spec and gossipsub 1.1 parameters. 
It can be tricky to get all clients to abide by the scoring parameters. Even if everyone is to spec and a client stops propagating messages (i.e if syncing or stalled) they can get penalized. 
It would be good to test this out to iron out any issues.

author: protolambda
content: I'm happy to help with testnet devops work

author: nishant0
content: Are the gossip scoring params checked into the specs repo ?

author: agemanning
content: I don't think so. We are using these: https://gist.github.com/blacktemplar/5c1862cb3f0e32a1a7fb0b25e79e6e2c#file-generate-scoring-params-py

author: agemanning
content:
There is a posted version of template scoring from which these are derived in a common telegram group. 
Even if they are not implemented in all clients, it would still be useful to have a testnet of up-to-date clients, so clients can individually test their own scoring params against each other to see if we all abide by what we expect and adjust accordingly.

author: nishant0
content: Ok great thanks for this, we can definitely start a testnet to test this out. I will try to get my PR into prysm master by end of this week, so that we can also start testing and playing around with it

author: agemanning
content: Yeah. Its not a requirement to have scoring on the testnet when it launches. But it would be a good testing ground for when scoring is implemented. Clients could add it later and see how it performs

author: agemanning
content: For us, we could help identify any gossip behaviours that are unexpected

author: nishant0
content: Yeap agreed, would be good to have  it running for everyone

author: agemanning
content: The requirement would be to have gossipsub to spec (strict validation, current message-id) also not subscribing whilst syncing.
